answers.answer: the next step is conjoint counseling..two of you together working this out with a therapist leading the discussion.  This may wake him up so he starts being more aggressive about work and his weight...areas where he is acting like a defeated person...and defeated people are often not interested in sex....its a form of depressive withdrawal...enough to talk about with a therapist.

question: I have been married over 30 years and sex has always been and issue.  I used to cry myself to sleep because he wouldn't touch me and he was lying there right beside me.  I love him and we are good friends.  I told him I feel like his mother instead of his wife.  I take care of all of our family business and he does nothing.  His has been dignosed with type 2 diabetes and he is overweight.  The doctor dsays if he lost weight he will go off the drugs and we both know this could help his function.  He doesn't even try.  Over the past several years we may have sex once a year and it is usally after I cry about it.  He says he never thinks about sex and does not seem concerned about my needs.  He says I should tell him when I want sex and he will accommodate me--great I could hire a male hooker for that.  I am at wits end and truly don't want to spend my remaining years without sex.  I enjoy it and I think I should have a partner that does too.  His hormones has been tested and he is fine.  He refuses counseling. Now what do I do?
title: husband total lack of interest in sex or physical contact
